title: MultiFlow: A unified deep learning framework for multi-vessel classification, segmentation and clustering of phase-contrast MRI validated on a multi-site single ventricle patient cohort
author: Tina Yao, Nicole St. Clair, Gabriel F. Miller, FORCE Investigators, Jennifer A. Steeden, Rahul H. Rathod, Vivek Muthurangu, ..., Haohe Liu (University of Surrey)
relevance_why: The methods used for segmentation and clustering can inspire new approaches in audio signal processing, especially regarding temporal features and feature sharing for classification tasks.
background: This study involves segmenting and classifying MRI flow images of blood vessels, aiming to improve diagnostic techniques for patients with complex congenital heart conditions.
contribution: MultiFlow introduces a unified deep learning model to solve multi-vessel segmentation and classification in phase-contrast MRI, achieving high accuracy across five distinct vessels.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods utilized individual classifiers and networks for each vessel, leading to inefficiencies.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work combines classification and segmentation tasks in a single model, improving performance through shared feature extraction.

key_innovation: The incorporation of a tunable parameter within the segmentation model allows flexibility with input series descriptions, enhancing classification accuracy especially in varying anatomical conditions.
real_world_impact: This methodological advancement can facilitate better clinical assessments in congenital heart disease, potentially improving patient outcomes and guiding treatment strategies.
limitations: Model misclassifications occur in atypical anatomical conditions, particularly affecting patients with dextrocardia.

new_terms.phase-contrast MRI: **Phase-contrast magnetic resonance imaging (PCMR)** is a specialized MRI technique used to measure blood flow and cardiac function by encoding velocity information in the generated images.
new_terms.Dice score: **Dice score** is a statistical measure used to gauge the similarity between two samples, often utilized in evaluating the accuracy of image segmentation.
